comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Might be Harriet Burton Laidlaw (1873-1949) (Mrs. James Lee Laidlaw)? www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=4034 oasis.lib.harvard.edu/oasis/deliver/~sch00682

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: This is part of the women's suffrage activities on July 5, 1915. The New York Times account of the day says the group going to Bedloe's (Liberty) Island was taken there aboard the yacht Tourist. I think that is where this photo was taken. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F60711FB3B5C13738... The Times article says that Mrs. James Lees Laidlaw participated in the ceremony, so that's who we have in this one. Mr. James Lees Laidlaw was also present, as President of the Men's League.
